alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 5:00PM MDT until August 05 at 6:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL LARIMER COUNTY... At 500 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that heavy rain had fallen across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pingree Park, Hourglass Reservoir, Comanche Reservoir, Fish Creek. This includes the following additional locations... Sky Ranch. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry gulches is likely across the affected portions of the Cameron Peak burn scar. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain.
